name: demographically
content:

in a way that relates to demography (= the study of populations (= the people of a particular place, country, region, etc.), and the different groups that make them up): The region has changed demographically in the past four years, becoming more diverse, more suburban, and wealthier. The audience is demographically very diverse.
More examplesFewer examplesThe two groups in the study were demographically similar.They are demographically representative of a cross-section of the American public.Demographically, the rural parts of the country have, on average, older patients.
